html: 11.16.18  12:41 pm   You've got me thinking bout minor keys. Sure, there's some popular tunes in  minor, but if you listen to the radio, you're not gonna hear a 50/50 balance between major and minor keys. It'll probably be more like 90(maj)/10 (min)? Like I was paying attention on my car ride to work this morning and I didn't hear 1 song in a minor key. I also think that a lot of the songs that are in minor have a strong pull towards the major chords in the key (like songs in Amin really wanna hang on that Cmaj at some point), and a lot of songs that could be minor have more of a minor pentatonic/blues scale feel than straight up minor.
original_html: 11.16.18  12:41 pm   You've got me thinking bout minor keys. Sure, there's some popular tunes in  minor, but if you listen to the radio, you're not gonna hear a 50/50 balance between major and minor keys. It'll probably be more like 90(maj)/10 (min)? Like I was paying attention on my car ride to work this morning and I didn't hear 1 song in a minor key. I also think that a lot of the songs that are in minor have a strong pull towards the major chords in the key (like songs in Amin really wanna hang on that Cmaj at some point), and a lot of songs that could be minor have more of a minor pentatonic/blues scale feel than straight up minor.

html: 11.16.18  9:03 am   I realized yesterday that to deal with my negative emotions, I should let them run wild and put that anger towards something rather than keep them locked inside. Doing this is great because the next time I'm confronted with the thing that may scare me or upset me, it won't frighten me or shake me up. Instead, my emotions will be way more manageable and I'll probably be more comfortable with them since I acknowledge them and express them so much, rather than avoiding them and letting them have a negative affect on me.
original_html: 11.16.18  9:03 am   I realized yesterday that to deal with my negative emotions, I should let them run wild and put that anger towards something rather than keep them locked inside. Doing this is great because the next time I'm confronted with the thing that may scare me or upset me, it won't frighten me or shake me up. Instead, my emotions will be way more manageable and I'll probably be more comfortable with them since I acknowledge them and express them so much, rather than avoiding them and letting them have a negative affect on me.
